document.full_text: roger federer rejects the idea that the balance of power in men's tennis has tipped toward novak djokovic after a 32-match winning run and believes he can still beat pete sampras's record for time spent as world number one.
document.title: federer says he can still return to world number one
lines_and_colors: roger federer rejects the idea that the balance of power in men's tennis has tipped toward novak djokovic after a 32-match winning run and believes he can still beat pete sampras's record for time spent as world number one.
